title: 820-4924-A no PP5V_S3
message:
Hello

Little corrosion around smc, cleaned and reflowed.

GREEN LIGHT: OK
PPBUS_G3H_R: 12.8V
SMC_ONOFF_L:3V
PP3V3_S5: 3.6V
P3V3S5_EN: 3.6V
PP5V_S3: 0V
P5VS3_EN: 0V
PM_SLP_S4_L: 0V

Any idea?
Thanks!

title: 820-4924-A no PP5V_S3
message:
Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L (at same time).
If detected, check for pulse at PM_SLP_S4_L too.

title: 820-4924-A no PP5V_S3
message:
PM_PWRBTN_L: Drop Pulse ok

PM_SLP_S4_L: Nothing happens, always 0V.

title: 820-4924-A no PP5V_S3
message:
Do you get 3V3_SUS?
What about PM_DSW_PWRGD, SMC_ADAPTER_EN, PCH_DSWVRMEN, PM_BATLOW_L and RTC signals?

title: 820-4924-A no PP5V_S3
message:
PP3V3_SUS: 3.4V
PM_DSW_PWRGD: 3.6V
SMC_ADAPTER_EN: 3.6V
PCH_DSWVRMEN: 3.3V
PM_BATLOW_L: 560mV
RTC_RESET_L: 3.4V
PCH_SRTCRST_L: 3.4V
PCH_INTRUDER_L: 3.12V 
PCH_INTVRMEN: 3.44

title: 820-4924-A no PP5V_S3
message:
"PM_BATLOW_L: 560mV"
Must fix this!
Original 60/85W Magsafe 2 charger for sure?

Check R1410 too.

title: 820-4924-A no PP5V_S3
message:
Always worked with these boards with PS, but confirmed with known good 85W MS and same issue. 

R1410: 9.98KOhm (out of the board)

title: 820-4924-A no PP5V_S3
message: I reballed the SMC and same issue. Should I try with another one? (If so, could I use one from a 820-3476?)

title: 820-4924-A no PP5V_S3
message:
Test starting the board with both charger and (known good) battery connected.
Also try SMC bypass.

title: 820-4924-A no PP5V_S3
message:
I do not have a known good battery to test at the moment. 

Customers battery seems to be charging but no power.

Tested with Original 85W and customers battery and no power. 

SMC Bypass same problem. 

Should I try ultrasonic cleaner? (Since I found some corrosion around SMC)

title: 820-4924-A no PP5V_S3
message: Try known good SMC, just in case.

title: 820-4924-A no PP5V_S3
message: Could I use one from a 820-3476?

title: 820-4924-A no PP5V_S3
message:
It may boot the board, but is not recommended.
You can get weird issues...

title: 820-4924-A no PP5V_S3
message:
I replaced the SMC (from a  820-3476 ) and now I get the:

-PP5V_S3: 5V
-All big coils voltages (including CPU ones)
-PPVIN_S0SW_LCDBKLT: 0V
-TBTBST_BOOST: 0V
-the board takes 300mA 
-power button responds
-no video

Do you think this can be an issue of the SMC no beign from the same model?

title: 820-4924-A no PP5V_S3
message:
Did you test USB activity?

As now you've confirmed to have bad (original) SMC, find another from 4924 donor board.

title: 820-4924-A no PP5V_S3
message:
I replaced the SMC for one of the same model board but same issue. 

-No video on screen
-No external video
-Takes 800mA
-CPU gets hot
-Tried other BIOS (from the donor board) and same
-No USB activity detected.

Any idea?

title: 820-4924-A no PP5V_S3
message:
Check all SPI Bus Termination resistors and theyr traces.
PLT_RESET_L comes high?

Try known good BIOS, should be posted on the forum.

title: 820-4924-A no PP5V_S3
message:
Same issue
-All  "SPI Bus Series Termination" resistors in page 47 are ok. (All 22ohms) 
-tried this bios your provided and same [URL]https://drive.google.com/file/d/18m-YhIlNhX4Uf5njH8KHmRGZelvEXnD_/view[/URL]

Any idea? Thanks!

title: 820-4924-A no PP5V_S3
message:
"PLT_RESET_L comes high?"

Be sure traces between all SPI resistors are good.
Also check solders and traces of U6101.
Inspect J6100 for corrosion.
